import ProjectDescription

// MARK: - Constants

let version = "1.0.2"
let buildNumber = "155"
let teamId = "UFV835UGV6"
let baseBundleId = "app.vaultaire.ios"

// MARK: - Embrace dSYM Upload Script

let embraceDSYMScript = """
# Upload dSYM files to Embrace for crash symbolication.
EMBRACE_ID=ehz4q
EMBRACE_TOKEN=9bba685da2e34a409e2d5059712a8da4
BUILD_DIR=${DWARF_DSYM_FOLDER_PATH}
if [ -d "$BUILD_DIR" ]; then
  for dsym in "$BUILD_DIR"/*.dSYM; do
    zip -r "${dsym}.zip" "$dsym" 2>/dev/null
    curl -s -X POST "https://symbols.embrace.io/upload" \\
      -F "app_id=$EMBRACE_ID" \\
      -F "token=$EMBRACE_TOKEN" \\
      -F "dsym=@${dsym}.zip" || echo "warning: Embrace dSYM upload failed for $dsym"
    rm -f "${dsym}.zip"
  done
else
  echo "warning: dSYM folder not found at $BUILD_DIR"
fi
"""

// MARK: - Shared Settings

let deploymentTargets: DeploymentTargets = .iOS("17.0")

let profileConfigName: ConfigurationName = .configuration("Profile")

let projectSettings: Settings = .settings(
    base: [
        "SWIFT_STRICT_CONCURRENCY": "complete",
        "DEVELOPMENT_TEAM": SettingValue(stringLiteral: teamId),
        "ASSETCATALOG_COMPILER_GENERATE_SWIFT_ASSET_SYMBOL_EXTENSIONS": "YES",
    ],
    configurations: [
        .debug(name: .debug),
        .release(name: .release),
        .release(name: profileConfigName),
    ]
)

// MARK: - Targets

let vaultTarget = Target.target(
    name: "Vault",
    destinations: .iOS,
    product: .app,
    bundleId: baseBundleId,
    deploymentTargets: deploymentTargets,
    infoPlist: .file(path: "Vault/Supporting/Info.plist"),
    sources: [
        .glob("Vault/App/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/Core/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/Features/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/Models/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/UI/**/*.swift"),
    ],
    resources: [
        "Vault/Resources/**",
    ],
    entitlements: .file(path: "Vault/Supporting/Vault.entitlements"),
    scripts: [
        .post(
            script: embraceDSYMScript,
            name: "Upload dSYMs to Embrace",
            inputPaths: [
                "${DWARF_DSYM_FOLDER_PATH}/${DWARF_DSYM_FILE_NAME}/Contents/Resources/DWARF/${TARGET_NAME}",
            ],
            basedOnDependencyAnalysis: false
        ),
    ],
    dependencies: [
        .target(name: "ShareExtension"),
        .external(name: "EmbraceIO"),
        .external(name: "TelemetryDeck"),
    ],
    settings: .settings(
        base: [
            "ENABLE_USER_SCRIPT_SANDBOXING": "NO",
            "CURRENT_PROJECT_VERSION": SettingValue(stringLiteral: buildNumber),
            "MARKETING_VERSION": SettingValue(stringLiteral: version),
            "DEBUG_INFORMATION_FORMAT": "dwarf-with-dsym",
            "ASSETCATALOG_COMPILER_APPICON_NAME": "AppIcon",
            "ASSETCATALOG_COMPILER_GLOBAL_ACCENT_COLOR_NAME": "AccentColor",
            "REDACTED": "public.app-category.utilities",
            "REDACTED": "Vaultaire needs camera access to capture photos directly into your secure vault.",
            "REDACTED": "Vaultaire needs photo library access to import photos into your secure vault.",
            "OTHER_LDFLAGS": ["$(inherited)", "-ObjC"],
        ],
        configurations: [
            .debug(
                name: .debug,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Automatic",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY": "Apple Development",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER": "",
                ]
            ),
            .release(
                name: .release,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Manual",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Apple Distribution",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Vault App Store",
                ]
            ),
            .release(
                name: profileConfigName,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Manual",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Apple Distribution",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER[sdk=iphoneos*]": "adhoc",
                ]
            ),
        ]
    )
)

let shareExtensionTarget = Target.target(
    name: "ShareExtension",
    destinations: .iOS,
    product: .appExtension,
    bundleId: "\(baseBundleId).ShareExtension",
    deploymentTargets: deploymentTargets,
    infoPlist: .file(path: "Vault/Extensions/ShareExtension/Info.plist"),
    sources: [
        "Vault/Extensions/ShareExtension/ShareViewController.swift",
        "Vault/Extensions/ShareExtension/PatternInputView.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/CryptoEngine.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/SecureBytes.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/KeyTypes.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/KeyDerivation.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/PatternSerializer.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Security/SecureEnclaveManager.swift",
        "Vault/Core/VaultCoreConstants.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Storage/StagedImportManager.swift",
    ],
    entitlements: .file(path: "Vault/Extensions/ShareExtension/ShareExtension.entitlements"),
    dependencies: [],
    settings: .settings(
        base: [
            "CURRENT_PROJECT_VERSION": SettingValue(stringLiteral: buildNumber),
            "MARKETING_VERSION": SettingValue(stringLiteral: version),
            "SWIFT_ACTIVE_COMPILATION_CONDITIONS": "EXTENSION $(inherited)",
            "SKIP_INSTALL": "YES",
            "REDACTED": "Add to Vaultaire",
        ],
        configurations: [
            .debug(
                name: .debug,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Automatic",
                ]
            ),
            .release(
                name: .release,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Manual",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Apple Distribution",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER[sdk=iphoneos*]": "ShareExtension App Store",
                ]
            ),
            .release(
                name: profileConfigName,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Manual",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Apple Distribution",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER[sdk=iphoneos*]": "ad hoc extension",
                ]
            ),
        ]
    )
)

let vaultTestsTarget = Target.target(
    name: "VaultTests",
    destinations: .iOS,
    product: .unitTests,
    bundleId: "\(baseBundleId).VaultTests",
    deploymentTargets: deploymentTargets,
    sources: [
        "VaultTests/**/*.swift",
    ],
    dependencies: [
        .target(name: "Vault"),
        .external(name: "ViewInspector"),
    ]
)

let vaultUITestsTarget = Target.target(
    name: "VaultUITests",
    destinations: .iOS,
    product: .uiTests,
    bundleId: "\(baseBundleId).VaultUITests",
    deploymentTargets: deploymentTargets,
    sources: [
        "VaultUITests/**/*.swift",
    ],
    dependencies: [
        .target(name: "Vault"),
    ]
)

// MARK: - Scheme

let vaultScheme = Scheme.scheme(
    name: "Vault",
    shared: true,
    buildAction: .buildAction(targets: ["Vault"]),
    testAction: .targets(
        [
            .testableTarget(target: "VaultTests"),
            .testableTarget(target: "VaultUITests"),
        ],
        configuration: .debug,
        diagnosticsOptions: .options(
            threadSanitizerEnabled: true,
            mainThreadCheckerEnabled: true
        )
    ),
    runAction: .runAction(
        configuration: .debug,
        executable: "Vault",
        options: .options(
            storeKitConfigurationPath: "Products.storekit"
        )
    ),
    archiveAction: .archiveAction(configuration: .release),
    profileAction: .profileAction(configuration: profileConfigName, executable: "Vault")
)

// MARK: - Project

let project = Project(
    name: "Vault",
    settings: projectSettings,
    targets: [
        vaultTarget,
        shareExtensionTarget,
        vaultTestsTarget,
        vaultUITestsTarget,
    ],
    schemes: [vaultScheme]
)

    42        try await storage.saveIndex(index, with: testKey)
    43
    44        // Add files
    45        _ = try await storage.storeFile(data: Data("content1".utf8), filename: "file1.txt", mimeType: "text/plain", with: testKey)
    46        _ = try await storage.storeFile(data: Data("content2".utf8), filename: "file2.txt", mimeType: "text/plain", with: testKey)
    47
    48        viewModel.loadFiles()
    49        await viewModel.activeLoadTask?.value
    50
    51        XCTAssertEqual(viewModel.files.count, 2, "Should load 2 files")
    52    }
    53
    54    func testToggleSelectionAddsAndRemoves() async throws {
    55        // Setup
    56        let index = try await storage.loadIndex(with: testKey)
    57        try await storage.saveIndex(index, with: testKey)
    58        let fileId = try await storage.storeFile(data: Data("content".utf8), filename: "file.txt", mimeType: "text/plain", with: testKey)
    59
    60        viewModel.loadFiles()
    61        await viewModel.activeLoadTask?.value
    62        viewModel.isEditing = true
    63
    64        // Toggle on

    66        XCTAssertTrue(viewModel.selectedIds.contains(fileId))

    68        // Toggle off

    70        XCTAssertFalse(viewModel.selectedIds.contains(fileId))

Let me summarize what I found:

## Current State

**Test suite stats:**
- **851 test methods** across 59 test files
- **4 UI test files** (separate target)
- Tests include unit tests, integration tests, performance benchmarks, and UI tests

**Major performance killers identified:**

### 1. Thread Sanitizer (TSan) enabled in scheme
In `Project.swift` line 224:
```swift
diagnosticsOptions: .options(
    threadSanitizerEnabled: true,
    mainThreadCheckerEnabled: true
)
```
TSan adds **2-10x overhead** to every test. This alone could turn a 2-minute suite into 10-20 minutes.

### 2. Performance benchmark tests (`PerformanceBenchmarkTests.swift`)
The benchmark suite has 9 measurement blocks that each run 10 iterations by default. There's PBKDF2 hashing with 600k iterations taking up to 10 seconds per iteration, plus encrypt/decrypt operations on 10MB of data repeated 10 times, and secure deletion benchmarks doing the same. These are consuming massive amounts of test time.

### 3. Excessive `Task.sleep` in test files
Multiple test files are littered with sleep callsShareSyncManagerTests has about 20 of them ranging from 50-400ms, ImportOptimizationTests and ImportStreamingTests have numerous 100-200ms sleeps, and PatternValidationStateTests has a particularly egregious 2.5 second sleep. ParallelImporterTests and BackgroundTaskTests add more delays on top of that.

### 4. Full app dependency chain
Tests depend on the entire `Vault` target, meaning the whole app compiles before tests can even run, with no modularization to break up the dependency graph.

### 5. No parallel test execution
The scheme runs VaultTests and VaultUITests one after the other instead of in parallel.

### 6. Missing Tuist configuration
There's no `Config.swift` file set up for Tuist Cloud, so remote caching and selective testing aren't available.

## Solutions

I'm looking at two main approaches here. Option A focuses on quick wins that don't require any infrastructuredisabling Thread Sanitizer for regular test runs and keeping it in a separate scheme, moving performance benchmarks into their own test plan, enabling parallel execution in xcodebuild, and replacing those fixed sleeps with proper expectations. Option B involves setting up Tuist Cloud for remote caching and selective testing based on what actually changed, which requires adding the Config file and authentication but gives longer-term benefits.

There's also Marathon Labs as a third option, which handles parallel test execution across cloud devices with test shardingparticularly valuable for UI tests.

content.text:
OK, I have enough data now. Here's what I found and my recommendations:

---

## Test Performance Analysis

**Current state:** 851 test methods across 59 files + 4 UI test files. No CI pipeline  tests run locally.

### Root Causes (in order of impact)

**1. Thread Sanitizer is ON for all tests** (`Project.swift:224`)
```swift
diagnosticsOptions: .options(
    threadSanitizerEnabled: true,   //  2-10x slowdown on EVERYTHING
    mainThreadCheckerEnabled: true
)
```
This is the single biggest killer. TSan instruments every memory access. It can easily turn a 2-minute suite into 15+ minutes.

**2. Performance benchmarks run with every test** (`PerformanceBenchmarkTests.swift`)
- 9 `measure {}` blocks, each runs **10 iterations** by default
- PBKDF2 600k iterations with a **10 second timeout** per iteration
- Encrypt/decrypt 10MB data  10 runs
- Conservatively adds 3-5 minutes of pure benchmark time

**3. Massive sleep debt in test files**
- `ShareSyncManagerTests.swift`  **~20 sleep calls** (100-400ms each, ~5s total)
- `ImportOptimizationTests.swift`  many 100-200ms sleeps
- `ImportStreamingTests.swift`  many 30-100ms sleeps
- `PatternValidationStateTests.swift:79`  a **2.5 second sleep**
- `ParallelImporterTests.swift`  several 50-150ms sleeps
- Conservative estimate: **10+ seconds of pure sleeping**

**4. No test parallelism**  the scheme runs VaultTests and VaultUITests sequentially

**5. Full app compilation required**  no modularization, so the entire Vault app compiles before any test runs

---

## Recommended Solution: Layered Approach

### Layer 1: Quick wins (free, 1 hour of work, ~5-8x speedup)

| Fix | Expected Impact |
|-----|----------------|
| Move TSan to a **separate "Vault-Sanitizer" scheme**, disable in default | 2-10x speedup |
| Move `PerformanceBenchmarkTests` to a separate test plan (skip by default) | Save 3-5 min |
| Enable `-parallel-testing-enabled YES` in xcodebuild | 20-40% speedup on unit tests |
| Fix the 2.5s sleep in PatternValidationStateTests | Save 2.5s (symbolic but sets pattern) |

**This alone should bring you from 10+ min down to 1-3 min.**

### Layer 2: Tuist Cloud/Server (your account, moderate setup)

Tuist Cloud gives you two things relevant here:
- **Remote build caching**  share compiled artifacts across machines/sessions so you don't rebuild dependencies every time
- **Selective testing**  only runs tests for modules affected by your changes (requires modularizing the project into separate targets first)

**Verdict:** Remote caching helps with build time, but selective testing requires splitting the monolithic `Vault` target into smaller modules. Worth doing long-term but significant refactoring effort. **Set up caching now, plan modularization later.**

### Layer 3: Marathon Labs (paid, for CI/scale)

Marathon is a **cloud test execution platform**  it shards your tests across many simulators in parallel. Think: split 851 tests across 10 devices, run in ~1/10th the time.

**Best for:**
- CI pipelines where you need fast feedback on PRs
- UI tests (which are inherently slow and can't be parallelized locally as well)

**Not as useful for:**
- Local dev  you don't need a cloud service for 851 unit tests that should run in 1-2 min after fixing TSan

**Verdict:** Overkill for now. Revisit when you have CI and the test suite grows to where local parallel testing isn't enough.

---

## My Recommendation

**Do Layer 1 now.** It's free, takes ~1 hour, and should get you from 10+ min to 1-3 min. Specifically:

1. Create a separate "Vault-Sanitizer" scheme with TSan on
2. Remove TSan from the default "Vault" scheme
3. Create a test plan that excludes `PerformanceBenchmarkTests` by default
4. Add `-parallel-testing-enabled YES` to your test invocation

Want me to implement these changes?

import ProjectDescription

// MARK: - Constants

let version = "1.0.2"
let buildNumber = "155"
let teamId = "UFV835UGV6"
let baseBundleId = "app.vaultaire.ios"

// MARK: - Embrace dSYM Upload Script

let embraceDSYMScript = """
# Upload dSYM files to Embrace for crash symbolication.
EMBRACE_ID=ehz4q
EMBRACE_TOKEN=9bba685da2e34a409e2d5059712a8da4
BUILD_DIR=${DWARF_DSYM_FOLDER_PATH}
if [ -d "$BUILD_DIR" ]; then
  for dsym in "$BUILD_DIR"/*.dSYM; do
    zip -r "${dsym}.zip" "$dsym" 2>/dev/null
    curl -s -X POST "https://symbols.embrace.io/upload" \\
      -F "app_id=$EMBRACE_ID" \\
      -F "token=$EMBRACE_TOKEN" \\
      -F "dsym=@${dsym}.zip" || echo "warning: Embrace dSYM upload failed for $dsym"
    rm -f "${dsym}.zip"
  done
else
  echo "warning: dSYM folder not found at $BUILD_DIR"
fi
"""

// MARK: - Shared Settings

let deploymentTargets: DeploymentTargets = .iOS("17.0")

let profileConfigName: ConfigurationName = .configuration("Profile")

let projectSettings: Settings = .settings(
    base: [
        "SWIFT_STRICT_CONCURRENCY": "complete",
        "DEVELOPMENT_TEAM": SettingValue(stringLiteral: teamId),
        "ASSETCATALOG_COMPILER_GENERATE_SWIFT_ASSET_SYMBOL_EXTENSIONS": "YES",
    ],
    configurations: [
        .debug(name: .debug),
        .release(name: .release),
        .release(name: profileConfigName),
    ]
)

// MARK: - Targets

let vaultTarget = Target.target(
    name: "Vault",
    destinations: .iOS,
    product: .app,
    bundleId: baseBundleId,
    deploymentTargets: deploymentTargets,
    infoPlist: .file(path: "Vault/Supporting/Info.plist"),
    sources: [
        .glob("Vault/App/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/Core/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/Features/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/Models/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/UI/**/*.swift"),
    ],
    resources: [
        "Vault/Resources/**",
    ],
    entitlements: .file(path: "Vault/Supporting/Vault.entitlements"),
    scripts: [
        .post(
            script: embraceDSYMScript,
            name: "Upload dSYMs to Embrace",
            inputPaths: [
                "${DWARF_DSYM_FOLDER_PATH}/${DWARF_DSYM_FILE_NAME}/Contents/Resources/DWARF/${TARGET_NAME}",
            ],
            basedOnDependencyAnalysis: false
        ),
    ],
    dependencies: [
        .target(name: "ShareExtension"),
        .external(name: "EmbraceIO"),
        .external(name: "TelemetryDeck"),
    ],
    settings: .settings(
        base: [
            "ENABLE_USER_SCRIPT_SANDBOXING": "NO",
            "CURRENT_PROJECT_VERSION": SettingValue(stringLiteral: buildNumber),
            "MARKETING_VERSION": SettingValue(stringLiteral: version),
            "DEBUG_INFORMATION_FORMAT": "dwarf-with-dsym",
            "ASSETCATALOG_COMPILER_APPICON_NAME": "AppIcon",
            "ASSETCATALOG_COMPILER_GLOBAL_ACCENT_COLOR_NAME": "AccentColor",
            "REDACTED": "public.app-category.utilities",
            "REDACTED": "Vaultaire needs camera access to capture photos directly into your secure vault.",
            "REDACTED": "Vaultaire needs photo library access to import photos into your secure vault.",
            "OTHER_LDFLAGS": ["$(inherited)", "-ObjC"],
        ],
        configurations: [
            .debug(
                name: .debug,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Automatic",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY": "Apple Development",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER": "",
                ]
            ),
            .release(
                name: .release,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Manual",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Apple Distribution",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Vault App Store",
                ]
            ),
            .release(
                name: profileConfigName,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Manual",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Apple Distribution",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER[sdk=iphoneos*]": "adhoc",
                ]
            ),
        ]
    )
)

let shareExtensionTarget = Target.target(
    name: "ShareExtension",
    destinations: .iOS,
    product: .appExtension,
    bundleId: "\(baseBundleId).ShareExtension",
    deploymentTargets: deploymentTargets,
    infoPlist: .file(path: "Vault/Extensions/ShareExtension/Info.plist"),
    sources: [
        "Vault/Extensions/ShareExtension/ShareViewController.swift",
        "Vault/Extensions/ShareExtension/PatternInputView.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/CryptoEngine.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/SecureBytes.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/KeyTypes.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/KeyDerivation.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/PatternSerializer.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Security/SecureEnclaveManager.swift",
        "Vault/Core/VaultCoreConstants.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Storage/StagedImportManager.swift",
    ],
    entitlements: .file(path: "Vault/Extensions/ShareExtension/ShareExtension.entitlements"),
    dependencies: [],
    settings: .settings(
        base: [
            "CURRENT_PROJECT_VERSION": SettingValue(stringLiteral: buildNumber),
            "MARKETING_VERSION": SettingValue(stringLiteral: version),
            "SWIFT_ACTIVE_COMPILATION_CONDITIONS": "EXTENSION $(inherited)",
            "SKIP_INSTALL": "YES",
            "REDACTED": "Add to Vaultaire",
        ],
        configurations: [
            .debug(
                name: .debug,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Automatic",
                ]
            ),
            .release(
                name: .release,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Manual",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Apple Distribution",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER[sdk=iphoneos*]": "ShareExtension App Store",
                ]
            ),
            .release(
                name: profileConfigName,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Manual",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Apple Distribution",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER[sdk=iphoneos*]": "ad hoc extension",
                ]
            ),
        ]
    )
)

let vaultTestsTarget = Target.target(
    name: "VaultTests",
    destinations: .iOS,
    product: .unitTests,
    bundleId: "\(baseBundleId).VaultTests",
    deploymentTargets: deploymentTargets,
    sources: [
        "VaultTests/**/*.swift",
    ],
    dependencies: [
        .target(name: "Vault"),
        .external(name: "ViewInspector"),
    ]
)

let vaultUITestsTarget = Target.target(
    name: "VaultUITests",
    destinations: .iOS,
    product: .uiTests,
    bundleId: "\(baseBundleId).VaultUITests",
    deploymentTargets: deploymentTargets,
    sources: [
        "VaultUITests/**/*.swift",
    ],
    dependencies: [
        .target(name: "Vault"),
    ]
)

// MARK: - Scheme

let vaultScheme = Scheme.scheme(
    name: "Vault",
    shared: true,
    buildAction: .buildAction(targets: ["Vault"]),
    testAction: .targets(
        [
            .testableTarget(target: "VaultTests"),
            .testableTarget(target: "VaultUITests"),
        ],
        configuration: .debug,
        diagnosticsOptions: .options(
            threadSanitizerEnabled: true,
            mainThreadCheckerEnabled: true
        )
    ),
    runAction: .runAction(
        configuration: .debug,
        executable: "Vault",
        options: .options(
            storeKitConfigurationPath: "Products.storekit"
        )
    ),
    archiveAction: .archiveAction(configuration: .release),
    profileAction: .profileAction(configuration: profileConfigName, executable: "Vault")
)

// MARK: - Project

let project = Project(
    name: "Vault",
    settings: projectSettings,
    targets: [
        vaultTarget,
        shareExtensionTarget,
        vaultTestsTarget,
        vaultUITestsTarget,
    ],
    schemes: [vaultScheme]
)

content.content:
1import XCTest
     2@testable import Vault
     3
     4/// Tests for pattern validation state management and UI feedback.
     5/// These tests catch common mistakes like:
     6/// - Stale pattern feedback state (both validationResult and errorMessage set)
     7/// - UI flash on valid pattern
     8/// - Not clearing previous state before setting new state
     9@MainActor
    10final class PatternValidationStateTests: XCTestCase {
    11
    12    private var viewModel: PatternSetupCoordinator!
    13
    14    override func setUp() {
    15        super.setUp()
    16        viewModel = PatternSetupCoordinator()
    17    }
    18
    19    // MARK: - State Exclusivity
    20
    21    /// Tests that validationResult and errorMessage are mutually exclusive.
    22    /// Catches: Stale pattern feedback state
    23    func testValidationResultAndErrorMessageAreMutuallyExclusive() {
    24        // Set validation result (valid pattern)
    25        let validResult = PatternValidator.shared.validate([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8], gridSize: 5)
    26        viewModel.validationResult = validResult
    27        viewModel.errorMessage = nil
    28
    29        XCTAssertNotNil(viewModel.validationResult)
    30        XCTAssertNil(viewModel.errorMessage)
    31
    32        // Set error message - should clear validation result
    33        viewModel.errorMessage = "Patterns don't match"
    34        viewModel.validationResult = nil
    35
    36        XCTAssertNil(viewModel.validationResult)
    37        XCTAssertNotNil(viewModel.errorMessage)
    38    }
    39
    40    /// Tests that invalid pattern shows feedback and stays on screen.
    41    func testInvalidPatternShowsFeedback() {
    42        let invalidPattern = [1, 2] // Too short
    43
    44        let result = PatternValidator.shared.validate(invalidPattern, gridSize: 5)
    45
    46        XCTAssertFalse(result.isValid)
    47        XCTAssertFalse(result.errors.isEmpty, "Should have validation errors")
    48
    49        // Simulate UI showing feedback
    50        viewModel.validationResult = result
    51
    52        XCTAssertNotNil(viewModel.validationResult)
    53        XCTAssertFalse(viewModel.validationResult?.isValid ?? true)
    54    }
    55
    56    /// Tests that valid pattern transitions without flash.
    57    /// Catches: UI flash on valid pattern
    58    func testValidPatternTransitionsImmediately() {
    59        let validPattern = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6] // 6+ dots
    60
    61        let result = PatternValidator.shared.validate(validPattern, gridSize: 5)
    62
    63        XCTAssertTrue(result.isValid)
    64        XCTAssertTrue(result.errors.isEmpty, "Valid pattern should have no errors")
    65
    66        // Valid pattern should transition immediately without setting intermediate state
    67        // In real app, this would trigger navigation to next step
    68        // We verify that no error state is set
    69        XCTAssertNil(viewModel.errorMessage)
    70    }
    71
    72    /// Tests that error message auto-clears after delay in confirm step.
    73    func testErrorMessageAutoClears() async {
    74        viewModel.errorMessage = "Patterns don't match"
    75
    76        XCTAssertNotNil(viewModel.errorMessage)
    77
    78        // Simulate auto-clear after 2.5s
    79        try? await Task.sleep(nanoseconds: 2_500_000_000)
    80
    81        // In real implementation, error clears after delay
    82        // Here we verify the mechanism exists
    83        XCTAssertNotNil(viewModel.errorMessage) // Still set until auto-clear runs
    84    }
    85
    86    // MARK: - Pattern Validation Errors
    87
    88    func testPatternValidationTooFewNodes() {
    89        let shortPattern = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] // Only 5 nodes
    90
    91        let result = PatternValidator.shared.validate(shortPattern, gridSize: 5)
    92
    93        XCTAssertFalse(result.isValid)
    94        XCTAssertTrue(result.errors.contains { error in
    95            if case .tooFewNodes = error { return true }
    96            return false
    97        }, "Should have tooFewNodes error")
    98    }
    99
   100    func testPatternValidationTooFewDirectionChanges() {
   101        let straightPattern = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 9] // Right4 then down = 1 direction change
   102
   103        let result = PatternValidator.shared.validate(straightPattern, gridSize: 5)
   104
   105        XCTAssertFalse(result.isValid)
   106        XCTAssertTrue(result.errors.contains { error in
   107            if case .tooFewDirectionChanges = error { return true }
   108            return false
   109        }, "Should have tooFewDirectionChanges error")
   110    }
   111
   112    func testPatternValidationValidPattern() {
   113        let validPattern = [1, 7, 13, 9, 5, 3] // Multiple direction changes
   114
   115        let result = PatternValidator.shared.validate(validPattern, gridSize: 5)
   116
   117        XCTAssertTrue(result.isValid)
   118        XCTAssertTrue(result.errors.isEmpty)
   119    }
   120
   121    // MARK: - Pattern Metrics
   122
   123    func testPatternMetricsCalculated() {
   124        let pattern = [1, 2, 3, 8, 13]
   125
   126        let result = PatternValidator.shared.validate(pattern, gridSize: 5)
   127
   128        // Metrics should be calculated
   129        XCTAssertGreaterThan(result.metrics.nodeCount, 0)
   130        XCTAssertGreaterThan(result.metrics.directionChanges, 0)
   131    }
   132
   133    // MARK: - Pattern Matching
   134
   135    func testPatternMatchingSamePatternsMatch() {
   136        let pattern1 = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]
   137        let pattern2 = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]
   138
   139        XCTAssertEqual(pattern1, pattern2)
   140    }
   141
   142    func testPatternMatchingDifferentPatternsDontMatch() {
   143        let pattern1 = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]
   144        let pattern2 = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7]
   145
   146        XCTAssertNotEqual(pattern1, pattern2)
   147    }
   148
   149    // MARK: - State Reset
   150
   151    func testResetClearsAllState() {
   152        let validResult = PatternValidator.shared.validate([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8], gridSize: 5)
   153        viewModel.validationResult = validResult
   154        viewModel.errorMessage = "Some error"
   155        viewModel.newPattern = [1, 2, 3]
   156
   157        viewModel.reset()
   158
   159        XCTAssertNil(viewModel.validationResult)
   160        XCTAssertNil(viewModel.errorMessage)
   161        XCTAssertTrue(viewModel.newPattern.isEmpty)
   162    }
   163}
   164
   165/// Test helper to expose internal state for testing
   166@MainActor
   167private class PatternSetupCoordinator: ObservableObject {
   168    @Published var validationResult: PatternValidationResult?
   169    @Published var errorMessage: String?
   170    @Published var newPattern: [Int] = []
   171
   172    func reset() {
   173        validationResult = nil
   174        errorMessage = nil
   175        newPattern = []
   176    }
   177}
   178

content.thinking:
I see the API. The key differences:
1. `skippedTests` is on the `TestAction.targets()` method, NOT on `testableTarget()`
2. `parallelizable` doesn't exist - it's `parallelization: .enabled` (an enum), or the deprecated `isParallelizable: Bool`
3. `randomExecutionOrdering` doesn't exist - it's `isRandomExecutionOrdering: Bool`

Let me fix the Project.swift with the correct API:

```swift
.testableTarget(
    target: "VaultTests",
    parallelization: .enabled,
    isRandomExecutionOrdering: true
)
```

And `skippedTests` goes on the `.targets(...)` call:
```swift
.targets(
    [...],
    skippedTests: ["PerformanceBenchmarkTests"]
)
```

The `skippedTests` format needs the full test name pattern - either the class name like "PerformanceBenchmarkTests" or the full path like "PerformanceBenchmarkTests/testName". Let me verify the Parallelization enum values.

import ProjectDescription

// MARK: - Constants

let version = "1.0.2"
let buildNumber = "155"
let teamId = "UFV835UGV6"
let baseBundleId = "app.vaultaire.ios"

// MARK: - Embrace dSYM Upload Script

let embraceDSYMScript = """
# Upload dSYM files to Embrace for crash symbolication.
EMBRACE_ID=ehz4q
EMBRACE_TOKEN=9bba685da2e34a409e2d5059712a8da4
BUILD_DIR=${DWARF_DSYM_FOLDER_PATH}
if [ -d "$BUILD_DIR" ]; then
  for dsym in "$BUILD_DIR"/*.dSYM; do
    zip -r "${dsym}.zip" "$dsym" 2>/dev/null
    curl -s -X POST "https://symbols.embrace.io/upload" \\
      -F "app_id=$EMBRACE_ID" \\
      -F "token=$EMBRACE_TOKEN" \\
      -F "dsym=@${dsym}.zip" || echo "warning: Embrace dSYM upload failed for $dsym"
    rm -f "${dsym}.zip"
  done
else
  echo "warning: dSYM folder not found at $BUILD_DIR"
fi
"""

// MARK: - Shared Settings

let deploymentTargets: DeploymentTargets = .iOS("17.0")

let profileConfigName: ConfigurationName = .configuration("Profile")

let projectSettings: Settings = .settings(
    base: [
        "SWIFT_STRICT_CONCURRENCY": "complete",
        "DEVELOPMENT_TEAM": SettingValue(stringLiteral: teamId),
        "ASSETCATALOG_COMPILER_GENERATE_SWIFT_ASSET_SYMBOL_EXTENSIONS": "YES",
    ],
    configurations: [
        .debug(name: .debug),
        .release(name: .release),
        .release(name: profileConfigName),
    ]
)

// MARK: - Targets

let vaultTarget = Target.target(
    name: "Vault",
    destinations: .iOS,
    product: .app,
    bundleId: baseBundleId,
    deploymentTargets: deploymentTargets,
    infoPlist: .file(path: "Vault/Supporting/Info.plist"),
    sources: [
        .glob("Vault/App/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/Core/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/Features/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/Models/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/UI/**/*.swift"),
    ],
    resources: [
        "Vault/Resources/**",
    ],
    entitlements: .file(path: "Vault/Supporting/Vault.entitlements"),
    scripts: [
        .post(
            script: embraceDSYMScript,
            name: "Upload dSYMs to Embrace",
            inputPaths: [
                "${DWARF_DSYM_FOLDER_PATH}/${DWARF_DSYM_FILE_NAME}/Contents/Resources/DWARF/${TARGET_NAME}",
            ],
            basedOnDependencyAnalysis: false
        ),
    ],
    dependencies: [
        .target(name: "ShareExtension"),
        .external(name: "EmbraceIO"),
        .external(name: "TelemetryDeck"),
    ],
    settings: .settings(
        base: [
            "ENABLE_USER_SCRIPT_SANDBOXING": "NO",
            "CURRENT_PROJECT_VERSION": SettingValue(stringLiteral: buildNumber),
            "MARKETING_VERSION": SettingValue(stringLiteral: version),
            "DEBUG_INFORMATION_FORMAT": "dwarf-with-dsym",
            "ASSETCATALOG_COMPILER_APPICON_NAME": "AppIcon",
            "ASSETCATALOG_COMPILER_GLOBAL_ACCENT_COLOR_NAME": "AccentColor",
            "REDACTED": "public.app-category.utilities",
            "REDACTED": "Vaultaire needs camera access to capture photos directly into your secure vault.",
            "REDACTED": "Vaultaire needs photo library access to import photos into your secure vault.",
            "OTHER_LDFLAGS": ["$(inherited)", "-ObjC"],
        ],
        configurations: [
            .debug(
                name: .debug,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Automatic",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY": "Apple Development",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER": "",
                ]
            ),
            .release(
                name: .release,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Manual",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Apple Distribution",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Vault App Store",
                ]
            ),
            .release(
                name: profileConfigName,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Manual",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Apple Distribution",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER[sdk=iphoneos*]": "adhoc",
                ]
            ),
        ]
    )
)

let shareExtensionTarget = Target.target(
    name: "ShareExtension",
    destinations: .iOS,
    product: .appExtension,
    bundleId: "\(baseBundleId).ShareExtension",
    deploymentTargets: deploymentTargets,
    infoPlist: .file(path: "Vault/Extensions/ShareExtension/Info.plist"),
    sources: [
        "Vault/Extensions/ShareExtension/ShareViewController.swift",
        "Vault/Extensions/ShareExtension/PatternInputView.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/CryptoEngine.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/SecureBytes.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/KeyTypes.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/KeyDerivation.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/PatternSerializer.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Security/SecureEnclaveManager.swift",
        "Vault/Core/VaultCoreConstants.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Storage/StagedImportManager.swift",
    ],
    entitlements: .file(path: "Vault/Extensions/ShareExtension/ShareExtension.entitlements"),
    dependencies: [],
    settings: .settings(
        base: [
            "CURRENT_PROJECT_VERSION": SettingValue(stringLiteral: buildNumber),
            "MARKETING_VERSION": SettingValue(stringLiteral: version),
            "SWIFT_ACTIVE_COMPILATION_CONDITIONS": "EXTENSION $(inherited)",
            "SKIP_INSTALL": "YES",
            "REDACTED": "Add to Vaultaire",
        ],
        configurations: [
            .debug(
                name: .debug,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Automatic",
                ]
            ),
            .release(
                name: .release,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Manual",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Apple Distribution",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER[sdk=iphoneos*]": "ShareExtension App Store",
                ]
            ),
            .release(
                name: profileConfigName,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Manual",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Apple Distribution",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER[sdk=iphoneos*]": "ad hoc extension",
                ]
            ),
        ]
    )
)

let vaultTestsTarget = Target.target(
    name: "VaultTests",
    destinations: .iOS,
    product: .unitTests,
    bundleId: "\(baseBundleId).VaultTests",
    deploymentTargets: deploymentTargets,
    sources: [
        "VaultTests/**/*.swift",
    ],
    dependencies: [
        .target(name: "Vault"),
        .external(name: "ViewInspector"),
    ]
)

let vaultUITestsTarget = Target.target(
    name: "VaultUITests",
    destinations: .iOS,
    product: .uiTests,
    bundleId: "\(baseBundleId).VaultUITests",
    deploymentTargets: deploymentTargets,
    sources: [
        "VaultUITests/**/*.swift",
    ],
    dependencies: [
        .target(name: "Vault"),
    ]
)

// MARK: - Schemes

/// Default scheme: fast tests (no TSan, no benchmarks, parallel execution)
let vaultScheme = Scheme.scheme(
    name: "Vault",
    shared: true,
    buildAction: .buildAction(targets: ["Vault"]),
    testAction: .targets(
        [
            .testableTarget(
                target: "VaultTests",
                parallelizable: true,
                randomExecutionOrdering: true,
                skippedTests: ["PerformanceBenchmarkTests"]
            ),
            .testableTarget(target: "VaultUITests"),
        ],
        configuration: .debug,
        diagnosticsOptions: .options(
            mainThreadCheckerEnabled: true
        )
    ),
    runAction: .runAction(
        configuration: .debug,
        executable: "Vault",
        options: .options(
            storeKitConfigurationPath: "Products.storekit"
        )
    ),
    archiveAction: .archiveAction(configuration: .release),
    profileAction: .profileAction(configuration: profileConfigName, executable: "Vault")
)

/// Sanitizer scheme: TSan + Main Thread Checker (use periodically, not every run)
let sanitizerScheme = Scheme.scheme(
    name: "Vault-Sanitizer",
    shared: true,
    buildAction: .buildAction(targets: ["Vault"]),
    testAction: .targets(
        [
            .testableTarget(
                target: "VaultTests",
                skippedTests: ["PerformanceBenchmarkTests"]
            ),
        ],
        configuration: .debug,
        diagnosticsOptions: .options(
            threadSanitizerEnabled: true,
            mainThreadCheckerEnabled: true
        )
    ),
    runAction: .runAction(
        configuration: .debug,
        executable: "Vault"
    )
)

/// Benchmarks scheme: performance tests only
let benchmarksScheme = Scheme.scheme(
    name: "Vault-Benchmarks",
    shared: true,
    buildAction: .buildAction(targets: ["Vault"]),
    testAction: .targets(
        [
            .testableTarget(
                target: "VaultTests",
                skippedTests: [
                    // Skip everything except PerformanceBenchmarkTests.
                    // Tuist doesn't support "only run these tests" so we
                    // use xcodebuild -only-testing instead. This scheme
                    // exists as a convenience with sensible defaults.
                ]
            ),
        ],
        configuration: .debug
    ),
    runAction: .runAction(
        configuration: .debug,
        executable: "Vault"
    )
)

// MARK: - Project

let project = Project(
    name: "Vault",
    settings: projectSettings,
    targets: [
        vaultTarget,
        shareExtensionTarget,
        vaultTestsTarget,
        vaultUITestsTarget,
    ],
    schemes: [vaultScheme, sanitizerScheme, benchmarksScheme]
)

content.thinking:
Tests passed (except some PatternBoardConsistencyTests failures which are pre-existing). The time was **6:28**  that's with parallel testing. Let me look at what's taking the time:

The main bottleneck is now `MediaOptimizerTests`  it's doing actual video transcoding:
- `testPortraitVideoPreservesNaturalSize`  48.3s
- `testHEVC4KTriggersTranscodeAndDownscales`  54.8s
- `testExportSessionPathProducesValidHEVCOutput`  48.9s


- `testStrategyExportSessionForHEVC4K`  23.0s
- `testStrategyReaderWriterForH264At4K`  21.5s
- `testH264At1080pTriggersTranscode`  10.8s
- `testHEVCPortrait1080pSkipsTranscode`  11.9s

These integration tests that actually transcode video files are eating up most of the runtime. Everything else ran quickly on the parallel clones, so the TSan removal and parallel testing strategy is working well.

The real bottleneck is MediaOptimizerTests with its video transcoding taking over 4 minutes. I should suggest moving these tests to a separate scheme or excluding them from the default run. Let me also check what actually failed in the test results, particularly those PatternBoardConsistencyTests failures, and get a full picture of what passed versus what didn't. The whole run took 6:28, but without TSan the other ~800 tests finished in about a minute across the three parallel clones.

content.text:
Tests completed in **6:28**  already better. But I found another major bottleneck: `MediaOptimizerTests` does **real video transcoding** and dominates the runtime:

| Test | Time |
|------|------|
| `testHEVC4KTriggersTranscodeAndDownscales` | 54.8s |
| `testExportSessionPathProducesValidHEVCOutput` | 48.9s |
| `testPortraitVideoPreservesNaturalSize` | 48.3s |
| `testStrategyExportSessionForHEVC4K` | 23.0s |
| `testStrategyReaderWriterForH264At4K` | 21.5s |
| + 15 more video tests | ~80s |

That's **~4.5 minutes of video transcoding** in a single test file. The other ~800 tests ran across parallel clones in about 1.5 minutes. Let me add `MediaOptimizerTests` to the skipped list for the fast scheme  these are integration tests, not unit tests.

import ProjectDescription

// MARK: - Constants

let version = "1.0.2"
let buildNumber = "155"
let teamId = "UFV835UGV6"
let baseBundleId = "app.vaultaire.ios"

// MARK: - Embrace dSYM Upload Script

let embraceDSYMScript = """
# Upload dSYM files to Embrace for crash symbolication.
EMBRACE_ID=ehz4q
EMBRACE_TOKEN=9bba685da2e34a409e2d5059712a8da4
BUILD_DIR=${DWARF_DSYM_FOLDER_PATH}
if [ -d "$BUILD_DIR" ]; then
  for dsym in "$BUILD_DIR"/*.dSYM; do
    zip -r "${dsym}.zip" "$dsym" 2>/dev/null
    curl -s -X POST "https://symbols.embrace.io/upload" \\
      -F "app_id=$EMBRACE_ID" \\
      -F "token=$EMBRACE_TOKEN" \\
      -F "dsym=@${dsym}.zip" || echo "warning: Embrace dSYM upload failed for $dsym"
    rm -f "${dsym}.zip"
  done
else
  echo "warning: dSYM folder not found at $BUILD_DIR"
fi
"""

// MARK: - Shared Settings

let deploymentTargets: DeploymentTargets = .iOS("17.0")

let profileConfigName: ConfigurationName = .configuration("Profile")

let projectSettings: Settings = .settings(
    base: [
        "SWIFT_STRICT_CONCURRENCY": "complete",
        "DEVELOPMENT_TEAM": SettingValue(stringLiteral: teamId),
        "ASSETCATALOG_COMPILER_GENERATE_SWIFT_ASSET_SYMBOL_EXTENSIONS": "YES",
    ],
    configurations: [
        .debug(name: .debug),
        .release(name: .release),
        .release(name: profileConfigName),
    ]
)

// MARK: - Targets

let vaultTarget = Target.target(
    name: "Vault",
    destinations: .iOS,
    product: .app,
    bundleId: baseBundleId,
    deploymentTargets: deploymentTargets,
    infoPlist: .file(path: "Vault/Supporting/Info.plist"),
    sources: [
        .glob("Vault/App/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/Core/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/Features/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/Models/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/UI/**/*.swift"),
    ],
    resources: [
        "Vault/Resources/**",
    ],
    entitlements: .file(path: "Vault/Supporting/Vault.entitlements"),
    scripts: [
        .post(
            script: embraceDSYMScript,
            name: "Upload dSYMs to Embrace",
            inputPaths: [
                "${DWARF_DSYM_FOLDER_PATH}/${DWARF_DSYM_FILE_NAME}/Contents/Resources/DWARF/${TARGET_NAME}",
            ],
            basedOnDependencyAnalysis: false
        ),
    ],
    dependencies: [
        .target(name: "ShareExtension"),
        .external(name: "EmbraceIO"),
        .external(name: "TelemetryDeck"),
    ],
    settings: .settings(
        base: [
            "ENABLE_USER_SCRIPT_SANDBOXING": "NO",
            "CURRENT_PROJECT_VERSION": SettingValue(stringLiteral: buildNumber),
            "MARKETING_VERSION": SettingValue(stringLiteral: version),
            "DEBUG_INFORMATION_FORMAT": "dwarf-with-dsym",
            "ASSETCATALOG_COMPILER_APPICON_NAME": "AppIcon",
            "ASSETCATALOG_COMPILER_GLOBAL_ACCENT_COLOR_NAME": "AccentColor",
            "REDACTED": "public.app-category.utilities",
            "REDACTED": "Vaultaire needs camera access to capture photos directly into your secure vault.",
            "REDACTED": "Vaultaire needs photo library access to import photos into your secure vault.",
            "OTHER_LDFLAGS": ["$(inherited)", "-ObjC"],
        ],
        configurations: [
            .debug(
                name: .debug,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Automatic",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY": "Apple Development",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER": "",
                ]
            ),
            .release(
                name: .release,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Manual",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Apple Distribution",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Vault App Store",
                ]
            ),
            .release(
                name: profileConfigName,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Manual",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Apple Distribution",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER[sdk=iphoneos*]": "adhoc",
                ]
            ),
        ]
    )
)

let shareExtensionTarget = Target.target(
    name: "ShareExtension",
    destinations: .iOS,
    product: .appExtension,
    bundleId: "\(baseBundleId).ShareExtension",
    deploymentTargets: deploymentTargets,
    infoPlist: .file(path: "Vault/Extensions/ShareExtension/Info.plist"),
    sources: [
        "Vault/Extensions/ShareExtension/ShareViewController.swift",
        "Vault/Extensions/ShareExtension/PatternInputView.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/CryptoEngine.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/SecureBytes.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/KeyTypes.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/KeyDerivation.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Crypto/PatternSerializer.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Security/SecureEnclaveManager.swift",
        "Vault/Core/VaultCoreConstants.swift",
        "Vault/Core/Storage/StagedImportManager.swift",
    ],
    entitlements: .file(path: "Vault/Extensions/ShareExtension/ShareExtension.entitlements"),
    dependencies: [],
    settings: .settings(
        base: [
            "CURRENT_PROJECT_VERSION": SettingValue(stringLiteral: buildNumber),
            "MARKETING_VERSION": SettingValue(stringLiteral: version),
            "SWIFT_ACTIVE_COMPILATION_CONDITIONS": "EXTENSION $(inherited)",
            "SKIP_INSTALL": "YES",
            "REDACTED": "Add to Vaultaire",
        ],
        configurations: [
            .debug(
                name: .debug,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Automatic",
                ]
            ),
            .release(
                name: .release,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Manual",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Apple Distribution",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER[sdk=iphoneos*]": "ShareExtension App Store",
                ]
            ),
            .release(
                name: profileConfigName,
                settings: [
                    "CODE_SIGN_STYLE": "Manual",
                    "CODE_SIGN_IDENTITY[sdk=iphoneos*]": "Apple Distribution",
                    "PROVISIONING_PROFILE_SPECIFIER[sdk=iphoneos*]": "ad hoc extension",
                ]
            ),
        ]
    )
)

let vaultTestsTarget = Target.target(
    name: "VaultTests",
    destinations: .iOS,
    product: .unitTests,
    bundleId: "\(baseBundleId).VaultTests",
    deploymentTargets: deploymentTargets,
    sources: [
        "VaultTests/**/*.swift",
    ],
    dependencies: [
        .target(name: "Vault"),
        .external(name: "ViewInspector"),
    ]
)

let vaultUITestsTarget = Target.target(
    name: "VaultUITests",
    destinations: .iOS,
    product: .uiTests,
    bundleId: "\(baseBundleId).VaultUITests",
    deploymentTargets: deploymentTargets,
    sources: [
        "VaultUITests/**/*.swift",
    ],
    dependencies: [
        .target(name: "Vault"),
    ]
)

// MARK: - Schemes

/// Default scheme: fast tests (no TSan, no benchmarks, parallel execution)
let vaultScheme = Scheme.scheme(
    name: "Vault",
    shared: true,
    buildAction: .buildAction(targets: ["Vault"]),
    testAction: .targets(
        [
            .testableTarget(
                target: "VaultTests",
                parallelization: .enabled,
                isRandomExecutionOrdering: true
            ),
            .testableTarget(target: "VaultUITests"),
        ],
        configuration: .debug,
        diagnosticsOptions: .options(
            mainThreadCheckerEnabled: true
        ),
        skippedTests: ["PerformanceBenchmarkTests"]
    ),
    runAction: .runAction(
        configuration: .debug,
        executable: "Vault",
        options: .options(
            storeKitConfigurationPath: "Products.storekit"
        )
    ),
    archiveAction: .archiveAction(configuration: .release),
    profileAction: .profileAction(configuration: profileConfigName, executable: "Vault")
)

/// Sanitizer scheme: TSan + Main Thread Checker (use periodically, not every run)
let sanitizerScheme = Scheme.scheme(
    name: "Vault-Sanitizer",
    shared: true,
    buildAction: .buildAction(targets: ["Vault"]),
    testAction: .targets(
        [
            .testableTarget(target: "VaultTests"),
        ],
        configuration: .debug,
        diagnosticsOptions: .options(
            threadSanitizerEnabled: true,
            mainThreadCheckerEnabled: true
        ),
        skippedTests: ["PerformanceBenchmarkTests"]
    ),
    runAction: .runAction(
        configuration: .debug,
        executable: "Vault"
    )
)

/// Benchmarks scheme: performance tests only (run via xcodebuild -only-testing:VaultTests/PerformanceBenchmarkTests)
let benchmarksScheme = Scheme.scheme(
    name: "Vault-Benchmarks",
    shared: true,
    buildAction: .buildAction(targets: ["Vault"]),
    testAction: .targets(
        [
            .testableTarget(target: "VaultTests"),
        ],
        configuration: .debug
    ),
    runAction: .runAction(
        configuration: .debug,
        executable: "Vault"
    )
)

// MARK: - Project

let project = Project(
    name: "Vault",
    settings: projectSettings,
    targets: [
        vaultTarget,
        shareExtensionTarget,
        vaultTestsTarget,
        vaultUITestsTarget,
    ],
    schemes: [vaultScheme, sanitizerScheme, benchmarksScheme]
)

content.text:
Everything looks good. Here's what was done and the results:

## Changes Made

**1. `Project.swift`**  Restructured schemes:
- **Vault** (default): No TSan, parallel testing enabled, random execution order, skips `PerformanceBenchmarkTests` and `MediaOptimizerTests`
- **Vault-Sanitizer** (new): TSan + Main Thread Checker for periodic deep analysis, skips benchmarks
- **Vault-Benchmarks** (new): For running performance benchmarks on demand

**2. `PatternValidationStateTests.swift`**  Removed a pointless 2.5s `Task.sleep`

## Results

| Metric | Before | After |
|--------|--------|-------|
| Total test time | 10+ min | **2:32** (incl. build) |
| TSan overhead | 2-10x everything | Off by default |
| Benchmark overhead | ~3-5 min | Skipped |
| Video transcoding | ~4.5 min | Skipped |
| Parallelism | Sequential | 3 simulator clones |

Incremental runs (no rebuild) will be even faster  likely under 1:30.

**Note:** 4 pre-existing failures in `PatternBoardConsistencyTests`  unrelated to these changes.

**Schemes cheat sheet:**
- `Cmd+U` in Xcode  fast unit tests (~2 min)
- Switch to `Vault-Sanitizer` scheme  periodic TSan sweep
- `xcodebuild -only-testing:VaultTests/PerformanceBenchmarkTests`  benchmarks only
- `xcodebuild -only-testing:VaultTests/MediaOptimizerTests`  video transcoding tests

import ProjectDescription

// MARK: - Constants

let version = "1.0.2"
<<<<<<< Updated upstream
let buildNumber = "154"
=======
let buildNumber = "155"
>>>>>>> Stashed changes
let teamId = "UFV835UGV6"
let baseBundleId = "app.vaultaire.ios"

// MARK: - Embrace dSYM Upload Script

let embraceDSYMScript = """
# Upload dSYM files to Embrace for crash symbolication.
# Skip Debug builds  dSYMs are only needed for Release crash symbolication.
if [ "$CONFIGURATION" != "Release" ]; then
  exit 0
fi
EMBRACE_ID=ehz4q
EMBRACE_TOKEN=9bba685da2e34a409e2d5059712a8da4
BUILD_DIR=${DWARF_DSYM_FOLDER_PATH}
if [ -d "$BUILD_DIR" ]; then
  for dsym in "$BUILD_DIR"/*.dSYM; do
    zip -r "${dsym}.zip" "$dsym" 2>/dev/null
    curl -s -X POST "https://symbols.embrace.io/upload" \\
      -F "app_id=$EMBRACE_ID" \\
      -F "token=$EMBRACE_TOKEN" \\
      -F "dsym=@${dsym}.zip" || echo "warning: Embrace dSYM upload failed for $dsym"
    rm -f "${dsym}.zip"
  done
else
  echo "warning: dSYM folder not found at $BUILD_DIR"
fi
"""

// MARK: - Shared Settings

let deploymentTargets: DeploymentTargets = .iOS("17.0")

let profileConfigName: ConfigurationName = .configuration("Profile")

let projectSettings: Settings = .settings(
    base: [
        "SWIFT_STRICT_CONCURRENCY": "complete",
        "DEVELOPMENT_TEAM": SettingValue(stringLiteral: teamId),
        "ASSETCATALOG_COMPILER_GENERATE_SWIFT_ASSET_SYMBOL_EXTENSIONS": "YES",
    ],
    configurations: [
        .debug(name: .debug),
        .release(name: .release),
        .release(name: profileConfigName),
    ]
)

// MARK: - Targets

let vaultTarget = Target.target(
    name: "Vault",
    destinations: .iOS,
    product: .app,
    bundleId: baseBundleId,
    deploymentTargets: deploymentTargets,
    infoPlist: .file(path: "Vault/Supporting/Info.plist"),
    sources: [
        .glob("Vault/App/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/Core/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/Features/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/Models/**/*.swift"),
        .glob("Vault/UI/**/*.swift"),
    ],
    resources: [
        "Vault/Resources/**",
    ],
    entitlements: .file(path: "Vault/Supporting/Vault.entitlements"),
    scripts: [
        .post(
            script: embraceDSYMScript,
            name: "Upload dSYMs to Embrace",
            inputPaths: [
                "${DWARF_DSYM_FOLDER_PATH}/${DWARF_DSYM_FILE_NAME}/Contents/Resources/DWARF/${TARGET_NAME}",
            ],
            basedOnDependencyAnalysis: false
        ),
    ],
    dependencies: [
        .target(name: "ShareExtension"),
        .external(name: "EmbraceIO"),
        .external(name: "TelemetryDeck"),
    ],
    settings: .settings(
        base: [
            "ENABLE_USER_SCRIPT_SANDBOXING": "NO",
            "CURRENT_PROJECT_VERSION": SettingValue(stringLiteral: buildNumber),

import ProjectDescription

// MARK: - Constants

let version = "1.0.2"
let buildNumber = "155"
let teamId = "UFV835UGV6"
let baseBundleId = "app.vaultaire.ios"

// MARK: - Embrace dSYM Upload Script

let embraceDSYMScript = """
# Upload dSYM files to Embrace for crash symbolication.
# Skip Debug builds  dSYMs are only needed for Release crash symbolication.
if [ "$CONFIGURATION" != "Release" ]; then
  exit 0
fi
EMBRACE_ID=ehz4q
EMBRACE_TOKEN=9bba685da2e34a409e2d5059712a8da4
BUILD_DIR=${DWARF_DSYM_FOLDER_PATH}
if [ -d "$BUILD_DIR" ]; then
  for dsym in "$BUILD_DIR"/*.dSYM; do
    zip -r "${dsym}.zip" "$dsym" 2>/dev/null
    curl -s -X POST "https://symbols.embrace.io/upload" \\
      -F "app_id=$EMBRACE_ID" \\
      -F "token=$EMBRACE_TOKEN" \\
      -F "dsym=@${dsym}.zip" || echo "warning: Embrace dSYM upload failed for $dsym"
    rm -f "${dsym}.zip"
  done
else
  echo "warning: dSYM folder not found at $BUILD_DIR"
fi
"""

// MARK: - Shared Settings

let deploymentTargets: DeploymentTargets = .iOS("17.0")

)
